   Scott Walker
   stated on February 27, 2011 in an interview on NBC's 'Meet the Press':
   "Most federal employees do not have collective bargaining for benefits,
   nor for pay."

Scott Walker says most federal employees do not have collective
bargaining for benefits or pay

   In an interview with Wisconsin Gov.

It's true, said Beth Moten, legislative and political director for AFGE,
   that most federal employees don't have collective bargaining rights over
   pay and benefits.

Although there are some
   federal workers who have collective bargaining rights for benefits and
   pay, "most" do not.
